278. Kerslake, Laura Lily (Mrs. George)
WHAT DID WESTERN CANADIAN FARMERS EAT?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

(Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.)

Name: Mrs. George Winkler
Address: Windthorst
Birthplace: London, England

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? 1912
Where did you set up housekeeping? Windthorst, Sask.
Where had you been living before that? London, England
For how many people did you prepare meals? 2
How far was it to your nearest store? 3/4 mile
How often could a visit be made to the store? once a week
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?
Sugar, prunes, rice, apples.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? Harvest Queen
In what quantities did you buy it? 100 lbs
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? 25¢
How much did you use graham flour?
Whole wheat flour?
Was flour milled locally? No
How far away? _______ What year? _______
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats?
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? __________ Whole wheat? __________ Farina? __________
Other? __________
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge?
How did you grind it? __________

That year did you start housekeeping? 1910
Where did you get your housekeeping? North Dakota
There had you been living before that? Kansas, Missouri
For how long? About two years
How far was it to the store? 25 miles
How often did you go to town? Weekly
What groceries did you buy at the store? Bread, milk, eggs

Agree to meet me off.

There did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (well, river, slough, dugout) ..................................................................

How far was this water from your home? ...................................................

How was it brought to the home? (pail, barrel, tank) ...........................................

Regarding water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

after using water out of well for 30 years had it tested and was pronounced unfit for consumption. Now use water from well beside dugout.
12. WATER SUPPLY

There did you get water for drinking and for cooking? (a.l.l., river, cistern, dugout) well

If so for how far was this water from your house? 1/4 mile

How was it brought to the house? (pail, barrel, tank) well

For ailing water supply, mention any changes which have taken place since you first started homesteading. Give dates where possible.

After using water out of well for 30 years had it tested and was pronounced unfit for consumption. Will not make from well treated sewage.
13. SOAP

Did you buy laundry soap or make your own? Bought at store.

If you made your own, did you use lye? Wood ashes?

What kinds of laundry soap did the grocer handle? Royallean.

14. FUEL

What fuel did you use in the earliest days? Wood.

Where did you get your fuel? Moose Mountains.

Mention any changes in the use of fuels which have taken place since you first started housekeeping, giving dates where possible.

Have enough wood on our own place, use about 2 tons of coal.

16. WRAPPERS AND CONTAINERS

Mention any changes which you recall in the wrappers and containers received with the food you purchased (give dates where possible).

wooden boxes

17. Give a typical day's menu (breakfast, dinner & supper) for the earliest year you can remember. Give the year and list the members of the family with their ages at this time. State the approximate month, e.g., winter or summer.

1910
Breakfast: Oatmeal porridge, dryed pork and eggs
Dinner: Dried pork, potatoes (pigweed when available)
pudding

18. What year did you serve your first Christmas dinner in Eastern Canada? ...................... Give the menu. List those present and give their approximate ages at that time.

19. Were you ever reduced to almost starvation level living on one or two locally produced foods? Give details.

During homesteading days 1905-6 Bought little else than flour

22. When did you begin to rely on purchased foods and prepared foods instead of homegrown and home prepared foods? (Give as many details and dates as possible).

We are buying more canned foods during the last three years because of having more money to spend.

23. Please add other details from your early experiences of buying groceries and securing foods in other ways before pioneer days in Western Canada. We are keeping more canned food during the hard times just because of having more money to spend.
